ature, Shard walked toward him.

> "Hey!" he called, rocket launcher in ha=
nd, but not 
> aimed, "Who are you, and what the slag is going 
> on here?"=


Myrmidon rose from the wreckage of sweeps that litered the ground around =
him, his feral optics raking across yhe devastation. His armor and face pla=
te were heavilly damaged, and yet strangely the metal was healing  itself, =
like clay it shifted and flexed as nanites repaired his nearly broken form.=


He looked over at the approaching new commer (Shard), "We should be askin=
g you that question!" His voice - despite the damage to his body - was stil=
l powerful and commanding. 

Myrmidon's sensors tuned in on Shard's Predico=
n energy signaure as he turned to face him. Like Shard, Myrmidon raised  no=
 weapon, but as he faced Shard, Myrmidon's shoulder mounted motar cannons t=
urned unintentionally with him. However they showed no sign of activation.
=

"We are the Predicons and I am Myrmidon!" As he spoke he kicked a burnt ou=
t sweep as he stepped closer to Shard, "Who in blazes are you?!"

Preston 
=
(Myrmidon)
